etymology.description: 冃(冃) (mào, "crown") + 頁(页) (yè, "head") = crown on a head -> crown
etymology.interpretation: The character 冕(miǎn, "crown") combines 冃(冃) (mào, "crown"), depicting the shape of a crown, with 頁(页) (yè, "head"), representing the positioning on a head. This composition effectively illustrates the concept of a crown being worn on one's head.

examples.chinese: 国王戴冕(國王戴冕)，威仪四射(威儀四射)。
examples.english: The king wears a crown, exuding majestic authority.

examples.chinese: 古代帝王的冕象征着无上的荣耀(古代帝王的冕象徵著無上的榮耀)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài dìwáng de miǎn xiàngzhēngzhe wúshàng de róngyào.
examples.english: The crown of ancient emperors symbolizes supreme glory.
